com.github.maxstupo.flatengine

Class FlatEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.maxstupo.flatengine.FlatEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEngine

    public class FlatEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements IEngine
    This class is the game engine, it handles all sub-components that make a game engine such as rendering, IO and game states.
    Author:
    Maxstupo

                  com.github.maxstupo.jflatlog.JFlatLog log)
        Create a new FlatEngine object.
        Parameters:
        loop - the implementation of the game loop.
        log - the logger this engine will use to log information to, if null JFlatLog.get() is used.

      • createWindow

        public void createWindow(java.lang.String title,
                         int width,
                         int height,
                         boolean resizable,
                         int closeOperation)
                  throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Creates a window for this engine. This method can only be called once.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the game window.
        width - the width of the game window.
        height - the height of the game window.
        resizable - true if the window can be resized.
        closeOperation - what occurs when the window is closed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this method has already been called previously.

      • isResized

        public boolean isResized()
        Returns true if the game window has been resized during this update.
        Returns:
        true if the game window has been resized during this update.

      • setFullscreen

        public FlatEngine setFullscreen(boolean fullscreen)
        Sets if the game window is fullscreen.

        Note: If createWindow(String, int, int, boolean, int) hasn't been called yet this method does nothing.

        Parameters:
        fullscreen - true to set the game window to fullscreen.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining.

        this object for chaining.

        public void registerScreen(java.lang.String id,
                           java.lang.Class<? extends AbstractScreen> screen)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Register a screen to the ScreenManager. This is a convenience method of ScreenManager.registerScreen(String, Class)
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the screen.
        screen - the screen to add.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if id is null, screen is null or id is already registered.
